intro: Endlicheria tschudyana, commonly known as the Tschudy's endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features palmate leaves with a lobed structure, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
